node.title: Michelle was excited to take a sales job with an online flower company, but quickly she 'didn't feel right'
node.alt: a woman is standing next to pots of colourful flowers
node.description: The consumer watchdog is investigating whether large flower deliveryÂ companies are misleading people using tactics online to make their services appear local.
node.content:
["Michelle*\u00a0was excited to take a sales job with Roses Only, an online flower delivery service, but she only lasted two weeks in the job.", "She was concerned about some of the practices she observed during that time, which she believed misled consumers.", "\"I thought I was working for Roses Only, but I was told I'd be working for Sarah's Flowers, and I had no idea who they were.\"", "The concerns she raised after her two-week stint with the company are representative of wider issues in\u00a0the flower industry that are being probed by the national consumer watchdog.", "", "
'Michelle' says she quit working for Roses Only because she didn't want to continue deceiving customers.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "
No local shopfront, evasive tactics
", "When you search for a local florist online, multiple Australian town names are linked to Roses Only.", "The company, owned by\u00a0Flowerscorp, uses a number of different domain names like Sarah's Flowers or Meg's Flowers\u00a0that have a local town description and a number for customers to call, but no local shopfront.", "\"[Customers]\u00a0would ring up thinking you're in a suburb and you would say 'oh, yeah we're sort of just up the road?',\" Michelle\u00a0said.", "\"And they would say 'Aren't you in the shopping centre here or are you there?' and you would say 'Yeah, we've got stores in the area'.\"", "Michelle\u00a0provided the ABC with what she said were internal Roses Only training materials which directed staff on how to sidestep customer questions about their location.", "\"DON'T LIE. Be positive, embellish, reaffirm but don't lie. (e.g. Do not say 'we are the florist in Paddington'),\" the material stated.", "The documents included directions for what the company described as \"controlling the call\".", "\"Once you have answered a tricky question, immediately follow it up with a positive question that takes the customer back to buying flowers,\" the training material said.", "In another section addressing customer concerns,\u00a0staff are directed on how to respond to the question: 'Are you the florist in [suburb]?'", "", "
Internal training documents at Roses Only.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "The training material directs staff to respond with: \"We deliver there all the time, what flowers did you have in mind?\"", "\"This should be stated, and then it is important to move on and change the focus point,\" the training material said.", "Michelle said orders were\u00a0sent to a number of distribution centres around the country and then delivered to customers.", "She said she\u00a0felt as if the job involved \"scamming people\".", "\"That was my first sales job, and I guess sales itself has a bad rap,\" she said.", "
ACCC 'extremely concerned'
", "Roses Only is just one of multiple large companies in the industry using similar tactics and the issue has caught the attention of the consumer watchdog.", "The ACCC said it was\u00a0\"extremely concerned\"\u00a0about possible widespread deception in the flower industry, and the body has begun conducting a full investigation.", "", "
ACCC Chairman Rod Sims says\u00a0he is 'extremely concerned' about possible widespread deception in the flower industry.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "Chairman Rod Sims said the approach from Roses Only appeared\u00a0to give the false impression the businesses were\u00a0local shops.", "\"It is illegal to mislead consumers,\" he said.", "\"If people think this is clever marketing, that's fine, they'll find themselves in court, facing a very large penalty.\"", "Sarah's Flowers, one of Roses Only's domain names, is the first result that appears when 'local florist South Melbourne' is entered into a search engine.", "", "
Roses Only uses a number of different domain names like Sarah's Flowers or Meg's Flowers, that have a local town description and a number, but no shop front.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "South Melbourne florist Zenaida Salem said she lost\u00a0more than 50 per cent of her online orders to large companies\u00a0which\u00a0incorrectly\u00a0advertise as local.", "Ms Zenaida said she spent\u00a0thousands of dollars a year on online advertising, but cannot compete with money spent by larger conglomerates.", "\"I believe it's deceptive,\" Ms Salem said.", "\"It's been a problem for a lot of years for us because they usually advertise in areas where they're not even there.\u00a0", "\"After all of the COVID, every locality, every business in that particular area needs support, and generally that's why they typed in South Melbourne, they want to support business in that area.\"", "", "
Ballarat flower grower Kristy Tippett said it's a difficult time for growers who are trying to sell local flowers.\u00a0(ABC News: Daryl Torpe)
", "Kristy Tippett is a flower grower in Ballarat, in Western Victoria,\u00a0who supplies garden roses to\u00a0the wholesale flower industry.", "\"I think there is a lot of nuance and a lot of challenges in our industry already, with sustainability, flower imports, wastage,\" Ms Tippett said.", "\"I think it really does a disservice to a lot of florists who are trying to push the message to buy local flowers and sell local flowers themselves.\"", "
Company rejects allegations of misleading conduct
", "Roses Only said It completely rejected any\u00a0suggestion it engaged in misleading conduct.", "Roses Only declined an interview but told the ABC the company\u00a0sourced\u00a0flowers locally, but if they were not available in Australia due to seasonality they sourced them internationally.", "Michelle said the world of online flower retail needed further scrutiny.", "She said workers may not realise \"the scale of how bad it is and how many people are fighting the businesses\".", "*Name has been changed"]
